Animate.css

Baked in to this repo is the valuable CSS3 animation engine Animate.css. More documentation and examples can be found on their website and GitHub repo, but the basics of how to use the Animate classes are below.

Browser compatibility

Because IE9 and below does not support CSS transitions, Animate.css will not work in those broswers. For that reason it is sreccommended that if the behavior of the element you are animating cannot work without the Animate.css transition you wish to apply, do not animate that object. The object should gracefully degrade for IE9 and below.

Examples

To animate an object via Animate.css, you must first apply the .animated base class to the element. Then apply the classname of the animation you want to apply. Use the controls below to apply eight basic animations to the headlien to see how it works.
